content: The Former Vice President Protection Act is the title of a legislative proposal. The Former Vice President Protection Act of 2008, also known as the Secret Service Protection for Former Vice Presidents and Their Families, allows for Secret Service protection for former Vice Presidents, their spouses, and children under 16 for up to six months after leaving office. The Secretary of Homeland Security can extend protection if deemed necessary. The amendments made by this Act will apply to any Vice President in office on or after the enactment date.
